TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UserProfileMembershipChange extends Microsoft.Office.Server.UserProfiles.UserProfileChange

Docs.summary: Represents a change to a membership.

remarks.para: For more information about memberships and types of membership groups, see Memberships Overview. For a code example about how to create a member group and add a member to the newly created group, see How to: Create Memberships.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MemberGroup As MemberGroup

Docs.summary: Gets the member group for the membership.
Docs.value: The member group for the membership.

remarks.para: For more information about memberships and types of membership groups, see Memberships Overview. For a code example about how to create a member group and add a member to the newly created group, see How to: Create Memberships.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MemberGroupId As Long
public: property long MemberGroupId { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the unique identifier (ID) for the member group.
Docs.value: The unique identifier for the member group.

remarks.para: For more information about memberships and types of membership groups, see Memberships Overview. For a code example about how to create a member group and add a member to the newly created group, see How to: Create Memberships.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SourceReference As String
public: property System::String ^ SourceReference { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the membership source unique reference for the member group.
Docs.value: The source unique reference for a member group.

remarks.para: The SourceReference property is used by the membership source to uniquely reference the group. For example, the membership source unique reference for Microsoft Active Directory is the distinguished name, and for SharePoint sites, it is the ID.
The source type of a membership can be a distribution list, a SharePoint site, or a custom membership source. For more information, see the enumeration.

For more information about memberships and types of membership groups, see Memberships Overview. For a code example about how to create a member group and add a member to the newly created group, see How to: Create Memberships.
